text: Adhd and medication As a   year old who was diagnosed at age   with  severe  adhd and has taken medications for it ever since  I think I somehow would have been better off without the meds  See I never learned to deal with my adhd  I just took the meds  I remember clearly as a child the doctor telling me that when I grow up I won t have to take my pills anymore  well that was a lie   I m in college  college is hard  made it even harder by choosing the hardest course I could pick just because I was good in high school and was told that I could do it and it would open up all the doors for me after  I regret that so much  I don t have the ability to study like everyone else does  I have a window of roughly  h during the day where I can actively study  Me studying at   pm to get the last preps for a test done just doesn t exist  I have to wake up at   am and plan taking my pills in consequence of the day if I want to just be able to study before the test   The  adhd generation  I feel has been helped to fit in society a lot better  but  I m a   year old who s literally dependant on pills to make me into any kind of productive human  I was never taught how to just find ways to deal with it  I was just given pills and that s it  My dad has adhd  never took pills and he s functional because he learned how to manage it Like yes  I most likely wouldn t have finished high school without medication  in a way I m glad I had it  I just wish I had been taught other methods than  take your pills  That s it   If anyone wants to add to my experience  feel free  I d love to know your stories or tricks or tips   Just needed to get this off my chest mostly
summary: As a child, I was diagnosed with severe adhd and I was given medication for it. Now I'm in college and I regret that I didn't learn how to deal with it better. I choose the hardest course just because I was good in high school. I have to wake up at am and take my pills in consequence of the day to be able to study before the test.
cleaned: child diagnose severe add give medication college regret not learn deal well choose hard course good high school wake pill consequence day able study test
